revised_title: Karl Johann Freudenberg: A Pioneering Chemist and Academic
tldr: Karl Johann Freudenberg was a prominent German chemist known for his extensive work on tannins, stereochemistry, and high polymers. He made significant contributions to the understanding of cellulose, starch, and lignin, and was a dedicated academic who built a strong research school at Heidelberg University. Despite facing challenges during the Third Reich, Freudenberg remained devoted to his work and made a lasting impact on the field of chemistry.
